ANDS-Grants.description: Driving is a highly visual task, yet we have little understanding of what information captures attention, or how it captures attention and why or how some objects or hazards attract attention while others do not. This project investigates the mechanisms of visual attention underlying hazard detection and distraction when driving, providing the cohesive theoretical framework currently lacking in the literature. Then using innovation in Head Mounted Displays, we will evaluate hazard perception and distraction in ambulance officers - one of the safest, yet demanding driving roles in the world, and from this we will determine the potential to develop new hazard perception training regimes for young drivers so as to create safer Australian roads
ANDS-Grants.title: Linkage Projects - Grant ID: LP130100181
